title.narrative: Service company for SMEs development in Fragile States

description.narrative: FCAI aims to promote the welfare of communities in fragile contexts through investments in sustainable and resilient SME's/companies. However since the companies in fragile countries are rarely investment ready the trust between the investor and investee n eeds to be built gradually therefore FCA will as a first step provide technical Assistance (TA) to the target companies (based on their unique needs) to enable them improve their systems. The next step is to then identify the 'gazelles' SME's/companies tha t have shown potential in terms of both sustainability and resilience and process these companies for further financial support (investment). There are clear signs that development banks (e.g. AfDB IFC and IsDB) are open to providing TA funds for SME's in fragile countries and are only held back by a lack of trustworthy service providers. FCA will therefore tap into this funding by leveraging its country level infrastructure and expertise (e.g. 3 offices and over and over 25 employees in Somalia 5 Employees in Eritrea and 26 Employees in Jordan) to ensure sustainability of this project in the medium term with the SME's paying their way in the long term. Considering country specific activity;In Somalia Finnpartnership?s ?The Somalia Business Pilot project? is coming to an end and the FCA project could utilize and strengthen the already established business relations between Finnish and Somali companies and to promote business projects and investments in Somalia. In Eritrea FCA has unique position as the sole I NGO on the ground and it will leverage its understanding of the operations environment and the existing networks with both the Government and the nascent private sector. FCA will carry out an assessment mission to Eritrea as precursor to a more thorough evaluation of business environment opportunities and challenges.In Jordan FCA is already working with business boosters and will with this project seek to pilot fin-tech from Finland as a way to accelerate business formation and also identify the tools tha t can be rolled out to other more fragile countries.
